kJOk-bM83eXxNBUbJFZM3g.text: After reading lots of reviews about this place, had to give it a go! The place itself looks like it has been modeled on how old private clubs would have looked back in the day.We went to the bar, it's not a typical bar where you can stand around, you are seated by one of the waiting staff.The ambience and surroundings are pretty flash & the drinks and food are expensive. All the drinks were pretty small - the Rhubarb G& T was really nice but SMALL! Service was very slow (we ordered a shot each of the Imperial Vodka when we arrived, however, it came out AFTER our starter - the place was not really busy and the bar was very close to us).None of the staff spoke Russian- not that that really matters but it just reminded me of a gimmicky place, a bit plastic & overpriced, more concerned with their money income rather than making your experience that bit more special.At least at other expensive places, you get little extras like nice complementary bar nibbles, etc that make the whole expensive experience worth it, leaving you with good memories, wanting to return.Overall, it was a nice eve but I think that was because of the company not the food/drink.I didn't feel we got value for our money  - they even added extra glasses of wine on to our bill - for the prices they charge and the fact it wasn't that busy, more care should have been given to the bill.Overall, it was a nice experience, but I'm sorry to say that I don't think I'd bother again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Nice Imperial Vodka
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

mBnS1W_X-i8tRo_DT4BjRA.text: I'm trying to think of a way to describe the sheer opulence of this place. It is the physical manifestation of all those images of hidden old English clubs were Lords would gather to discuss important issues and change the fate of England. It's full of dark mahogany, green leather seat cushions, and booths that manage to seem secluded even though they are next to each other.We went for a  friend's birthday and, given that we had a group of 10, we were told we had the private dining room as it was the only one big enough. I cycled over from work and, because I had been told it as fairly fancy, I brought some dress shoes along to boost my image (cycling shoes aren't exactly semi-formal wear). However, I probably lost any chance I had at looking respectable when I handed my helmet to the coat check girl. It's London, cycling is a popular way of life.Anyways, the hostesses are excellent gatekeepers, subtly blocking my way while inquiring if I had a reservation. Upon learning which group I was meeting, I was led downstairs and through the booths to the back room which is apparently the private drinking room. There we had a dedicated waiter who provided me with an decent Old Fashioned although I must say it was slightly sharp on the whiskey which indicates to me they didn't take enough time with the preparation. Still, it was more than palatable so I had a second.When it came time to eat, they insisted on carrying our drinks for us and led us upstairs, through the restaurant, and into the private dining room. This room is awesome with all these retro decorations on shelves. I'm talking old school robot toys, original edition boardgames, and a massive backgammon set. We could decide if we should play or just outright steal it. We decided to eat and drink instead which likely saved us from some jail time. Good life decision.Foodwise, I went with the snails for the starter and Onglet steak and chips for the main. The snails were tasty but I was disappointed that they had already been deshelled. Attempting to extract a snail from the shell is the most fun of eating them! The Onglet was medium rare (we weren't allowed to order to taste, only medium rare for some reason) and it's a steak that speaks for itself with minimal cooking. However, the chips were fantastic so I'll forgive them from depriving me of a bit of blood.I can't comment on dessert, sadly, as we had an excellent home-made chocolate cake instead. The recommended dessert wine (I think it was a Sauternes) was incredible and if it wasn't £30 a glass I would have got one all for myself. We ended up sharing between four but it was a very generous glass so not a problem.Price-wise, this is on the higher end of restaurants even for London. Including drinks and service, it came to about £80/person. I'd say it was worth it for the atmosphere and drinks and marginally worth it for the food. Maybe a good place to impress a date (say on the 3rd date...too exxy for a 1st date spot imho). Location is great (just across the street from Polpo and next to Graphic Bar) and very central.

hN58uMKSKFo3sdRt7eGD6w.text: I really liked the place, especially the champagne button :D The food was great: I ordered a pie and it looks so pretty as it was almost fake! The desert served in a ball couldn't have been better! Definitely recommend this place!

ouEdLUEXptj537pEkjabLw.text: The burger at Bob Bob Ricard is the reason that exercise exists. Without that, you're lost. Sadly, I appear to be losing... though if I thought that the reward was a guilt free burger at BBR then I'd be spending a lot more time on the rowing machine.There's a limited menu, mainly classic bistro dishes intermingled with a handful of left field caviar based choices (no doubt a small reminder of home for the Russian owner).The decor wouldn't be out of place in a top end French railway buffet (assuming that said buffet were decorated with beautiful blue leather seating and staffed by men in salmon pink jackets). The staff were attentive and friendly and while I had to ask twice for the bill, I wasn't exactly in a rush, and could quit happily have sat there all day.Starting with a sharp yet sweet pink grapefruit mimosa, I eagerly awaited my meat patty fix..The burger arrived cooked perfectly as requested, enough fat to make it silky smooth with little pieces of onion studded through. A nice char on the outside contrasted with the soft bun and the Kraft slice melted deep into the pores of the unctuous patty. The sweet pickles were excellent, and the only (very slight) bum note came from the slightly flabby and seemingly unseasonal tomato.As I polished off the last morsel, a salmon pink jacket dropped off a warm hand bowl and I sat back in my booth. The glamour of Bob Bob Ricard is a contrast with grimy old Soho, but somehow fits in perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

_Jbj7w8RHufRNDoaXpw6SA.text: The bar here is full of dreams and wonders.  It's beautifully decorated and the staff are wonderful, lovely human beings.  The drinks are delicious and of course the infamous 'press for champagne' buttons are far too tempting.  I've never actually dined here, but the menu looks exquisite and it's certainly something on my to do list.

zGGt6KeZaplvV2jpZwPJzA.text: Love this bar! The staffs are trulyfriendly and attentive. Surely a great place that you must go. Great service,delicious drinks and foods, and perfect ambiance. Perfect place that you mustgo. Highly recommended to everyone.

FyHKaTcouWqrmfEqZiKAwA.text: Where do you start? Ok yes maybe with the "Press for Champagne" button at every dinner table. Or with the delicious champagne cocktails. Or with the blue art deco interiors, light pink menus and placemats. Bob Bob Ricard is a wonderful place for drinks. All their campagne cocktails are delicious and I am especially fond of their espresso martini. The food is decent but definitely pricey. If I were to go back regularly, it would be more for the drinks than for a meal.

zAigcEtiDErbjbBOcQYt3w.text: The "press for champagne" buttons are the most fun thing here, but closely followed by a really fun and delicious menu - a lobster macaroni cheese which does have a heck of a lot of lobster in it, and their chocolate bomb and eton mess perle, where you crack into the edible shell to reveal a delicious dessert inside. Both fun and classy!

6sHdWFABdkzTnqSvaXZYaA.text: The atmosphere, to begin with, is beautiful. Nice booths, cozy, and great lighting. Then there were the staff. Attentive, but not overly so, friendly. The cocktails were delicious (a little small for my thirsty tongue). The food is great and reasonably priced. I did not have a starter so cannot comment on those but my mains - pig cheeks with carrots and a nice portion of mash potato - was spot on. The cheeks were tender, almost melt in your mouth. My partner had the special cottage pie which I had a small bite of and was tasty. We didn't order dessert but a friend who was with us did, she had the trio of creme brulee. It looked good and she seemed quite pleased. Will definitely be back!

PC9H7oDCRZCtidvek7NJAA.text: I was in London and wanted to make sure to have a really good beef wellington.My friend recommended this place and it was a really good!Before we began our meal, we all had a shot of the Russian Standard Vodka chilled at -17degrees.  Great way to start a meal.For starters, I recommend the Stinking Bishop Cheese Souffle and the Venison Steak Tartare.  The portions are quite big so definitely for sharing.  The souffle was nice and fluffy and just loved the flavor of the cheese.  The tartare was fresh and a great starter to the wellington.For the main course, we had the beef wellington -- its says in the menu good for two but it can definitely be good for three.  And we had the truffled mashed potato for the side.  The wellington was cooked to perfection with a nice crusty pastry and a flavorful mushroom filling.And of course, order a good robust bottle of red wine to go with the wellington.For dessert, we had the chocolate glory, the salted caramel ice cream and chocolate truffles.  The chocolate glory was a nice surprise...

LPAiDWw0kjNcA9_f3Ji1EA.text: Teal and baby pink is a color combination that would typically put one in mind of the choices you'd have for your new 1950s Frigidaire. In other words, not too sexay, if ya know what I mean.However, BBR makes it work - and in spectacular style.The booths are retro cool, and the lines of the interior are art deco. The marble, brass, stylized fonts, and little details (e.g., a button purely for champagne is at each table for you to order your refill) are transporting and make you feel a little off-kilter in a "Through the Looking-Glass" way. This is not a bad thing.The food was quite good. I had a Shepherd's Pie, and it was lovely to look at and lovely going down. It was already very savory, flavorful, and rich, so I was thrown off by the server's suggested inclusion of Worcestershire sauce. My arteries could do without, and the pie was perfectly fine on its own, thankyouverymuch. Maybe I'm a little bit of a cheapskate, but the prices seemed a little much for glorified comfort food (e.g., their rusk, ginger, etc. milkshake is 6.50 squids...which translates to a $10 milkshake. I mean, what?)Overall, a good experience with friendly and attentive service. However, I'd say it's more of an experience destination than a place that would enter my regular lineup...um....were I living in London and if I had a regular lineup, that is.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. The belly of the beast.
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Nom nom.

mALyG5Q397UHootyUYLutA.text: I am very selective in giving 5 stars but I would give Bob Bob Ricard more if I could! Photos do not do this restaurant justice, it must be seen in person to really appreciate how beautiful it is. It's apparent that like everything else at Bob Bob Ricard a lot of thought has gone into the design of the restaurant. The service was excellent, efficient and attentive with out being disruptive. I was there for a Vodka tasting, after drinking Smirnoff neat once many years ago and not remembering it as pleasant (it is my spirit of choice for cocktails), I was surprised to find that a "good" vodka goes down much more smoothly. We were served shots at a temperature of -18. In true Russian style we were given various foods (Jellied Ox Tongue, Salmon Row on Hard-Boiled Quail's eggs, Malosolo Cucumbers) to chase each shot which was a relief to my empty tummy! Various different price ranges of vodka were tasted, I favored the Kauffman Special Selected Vintage 2006 for having a touch of sweetness to it, even though as were were told the aim of vodka is to be tasteless. We also had a selection of starters, all of which I would highly recommend. The Scallops and Black Pudding as well as the Wafer-Thin Cured Orkney Beef being absolutely delicious and completely satisfying to my taste-buds. I look forward to many visits to Bob Bob Ricard to introduce my friends to such a unique fantastic restaurant.

0G7MsCyug5eudZgLjeMboQ.text: Having never officially 'tasted' Vodka before, I had absolutely NO idea what to expect at Bob Bob Ricard's tasting (a Qype event organised by Qype London Guru, Siany). As it turns out, it's nothing like wine tasting AT ALL. With wine tasting, you look at it (a lot), sip it, swill it around in your mouth, make appreciative noises like Mmm and Ahh, then say things like: The legs on that are rather impressive, don't you think? While doing this you nibble on things like cured meats, cheeses and smoked salmon blinis talking about how they complement your wine perfectly. When you taste vodka on the other hand, you knock it back then quickly take a bite of a bizarre salt-saturated Russian snack. You know what though? I thought it was absolutely brilliant, despite being incredibly dubious about drinking neat vodka with my meal. But hey, they do it in Russia all the time apparently! We were expertly guided through a range of vodkas served at BBR by co-owner Ricard, including the Kauffman Private Collection Luxury Vintage 2003  only 25,000 bottles were produced and at £18 per SHOT, it's something I could only dream of being able to afford. The general consensus of the group was that our favourite was the Kauffman Special Selected Vintage 2006 (about £8 per shot). So we all had another one at the end. I was also impressed by the Imperia by Russian Standard which, at £4 a shot, is much more in my price range. In terms of food, I got the opportunity to try things I'd never usually dream of ordering like Jellied Ox Tongue with Creamed Horseradish (which was surprisingly delicious), Salmon Row and Quails Eggs (hmm... not so much) and Scallops and Black Pudding with Truffle Dressing (SUPER yum!) I also was very impressed with the Wafer-Thin Cured Orkney Beef and Pickled Beetroot and Goat's Cheese Salad. You can see all my piccies of the wonderfully unusual food (if you like) at: foodspotting.com/?query=…  Everything was enjoyed in a beautiful private room adorned with Art Deco-themed decoration. This is definitely a restaurant with a big 'WOW' factor (helped immensely by their 'Press for Champagne' buttons at all the tables) and I cannot wait to get the chance to go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

ZiEUpcdFmEdRyfAInY9irA.text: I joined some fellow (extremely lucky) Qypers at a Vodka tasting here on Sunday and frankly I'd like to come back here every week. (Any chance of organising that Sian?) The first thing you notice as you enter is the opulent art deco stylings and attentive service from the staff, the banquette seating around the main part of the restaurant looked ideal for sinking into as you settle down for a long afternoon. We were in a private room round the back with a golden chandelier, interesting art work and a selection of vintage childrens toys on the walls. Unusual, yes, but it all worked rather well and the dark room helped us forget that, after the clocks had gone forward, to our bodies it was only 11.30. The signature drink of Pink Rhubarb Gin and tonic helped take the edge off and was delicious with an impressively frothy head. Our host for the afternoon was Ricard, who co-owns the place with his partner Leonid (or Bob, who has a 2 thirds share..) He took us through a selection of Vodkas stressing that the original point of the drink was not to impart flavour but actually to remove it. Through different processes of filtration, quality of ingredients and distillation the aim is to get a flavourless drink that just gives that slight alcohol burn at the back of the throat. The general consensus was that the closest to this was the first one we tried, the Kauffman Special Selected Vintage 2006, which had a slight sweetness but was otherwise almost neutral. I was also quite keen on the Imperia by Russian Standard and that is lucky because at £4 a shot as opposed to somewhere in the region of £15 for the Kauffman this is slightly more in my price range.. We were served food with each vodka and my favourites were, perhaps surprisingly the Jellied Ox Tongue with a delicious Creamed Horseradish and less surprisingly the Meat Pelmeni. These little dumplings, similar to Polish Pierogi, and served with Sour Cream and vinegar were incredibly more-ish and I think an afternoon scoffing them with a jug of Imperia would be quite fantastic. We were too full for a roast dinner after a selection of starters including beautiful scallops with black pudding and some blueberry cured Orkney Beef but I did have a rather tasty Cheese board. So, this place is fantastic, probably out of my usual price range though but I would make the trip for a special occasion. If it was cheaper I could quite happily come back every week, although maybe that is a good thing for the state of my liver.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

r0ewz0VyLJSCGdw8LggeCg.text: Pure loveliness.Stopped in here randomly with friends on the way to dinner. Still early, we were whisked downstairs to the bar which is intimate and lavishly decorated in an art deco inspired train carriage theme. I loved the booths with banquet seating and fold down leather seats flanking the tables. Even the floor was gorgeously attended to, decorated like a backgammon board. And the drink menu? Fab-u-lous. I tried the cucumber martini which was refreshing and not too sweet. Perfect for a romantic rendezvous or a catch-up with the girls.

1sTxgXSyXn8CAc1Qd50G9A.text: This place gets five stars just for the friendly staff. There were so many nice waiters that took care of us throughout the meal that I was suprised there are places like this that still exist and are not in some expensive hotel or restuarant. Love the decor and the bathrooms were very posh as well. Had the tea with assorted crumpets, breads, muffins, jam & butter. I highly recomment this place for an affordable afternoon tea. Fantastic!

gYS9b691ocyKFc8de6Hf2A.text: This place is a total dream. The design in here is really out of this world, the menus, the staff uniforms, the booths, the 'champagne please' button... The attention to detail is second to none. The retro train-carriage themed seating makes for an interesting and romantic setting without being too poke your eyes out. The staff were really on the ball and the service was seamless despite the place being full. The  Australian Chardonnay made me fall back in love with white wine on the spot and the pickled herring starter was an amazing start to the night. It's perfect for a fancy occasion, unless you're a total money bags, in which case, go there all the time and make everyone jealous.

oG_6ltyLX6QiDLoyplxLPw.text: I hovered between 4 and 5 stars for this.this really isn't everyone's cup of tea, but it is mine.I love the Soviet style of the place (it's Soviet, not Orient Express, and that's me talking as a designer.) When I say Soviet, I mean a restaurant in some Palace of something or other, as opposed to a concrete worker's bar. It's fabulous. Think of Stalin's cabin on the Tran-Siberian railway.The food is incredibly tongue in cheek. I had the Prawn Cocktail for starters and the Knickerbockerglory for desert, for example. Both were neither typical nor standard, but an incredibly glorified version of the two. But the main course, oh, the main course of beef ongelet was amazing.I came with my ex on my birthday. He's a veggie, and was also satisfied. I don't think there is anywhere quite like it. As I said, it's not to everyone's taste, but it's certainly to mine.

lywVPwDHxwML2GeHLf-2wQ.text: Imagine, if you will, walking into an end-of-the-world Wiemar cabaret, a bright salon on the eve of a revolution. The air rich with decadence and possibility, and the clear whiff of luxury. That's how it felt, dining in the idiosyncratic and timeless BobBobRicard. The Wonkerish press for champagne button, the Pullman booths, the truffle, champagne and caviar laden menu. And of course there's Leonid (aka Bob) leaning rakishly against our green leather booth. Champagne? he said, after all, it is Wednesday. I love this sort of almost-too-luxurious, over the top place, all green leather, dark wood and art deco tiles, like some glam and stylish Al Capone speakeasy transported to a twenties Moscow back alley. My chosen starter was a beautifully prepared venison tartar. The seasoning was spot on with no Worcestershire or Tabasco needed. Unctuous, smooth, meaty with a strong, but not overwhelming taste of deer. I could have had this for starter, main and dessert. Hell, i could've scoffed this bambi for elevensies and been happy. Quails eggs and truffles showed deft handling of strong flavours. Instead of overwhelming the creamy eggs, the truffle added an intense bouquet of earthy richness. And the prawn cocktail was a pitch perfect rendition of the fifties classic. Big juicy pink prawns hung like punch glasses around a bowl. Roast leg of lamb was tasty, a classic example of well sourced meat, cooked simply and brilliantly. This was actually as good as my mum's lamb, which is not something I've ever been able to say of any restaurant roast lamb. Veal Holstein was flawlessly executed, with a wee little quail's egg fried and laid atop the golden crispy crunchy plate of tender cow. This was good stuff. And it came with smooth, earthy truffled mash, and a hidden pool of seret sauce...shhhhh. And the pudding  oh my God the pudding. A masterstroke of menu choosing here, I went for the comparitively plain sounding salted caramel ice cream with oh, some other flavours. Spooned into my mouth after a shot of frozen vodka, the sweet-savoury tang made my toes curl and squeezed a little jig of pleasure out of my tapping feet. So, BobBobRicard. Big, bold and somehow still well balanced. Not for a daily visits, it'd tarnish the allure. But when the world's crashing down around my ears, this is the place where I'll be partying. Going down, all hands on the champagne bottle.

4VfZljWK8lqsbG5w5LX3EQ.text: A Soho-centric designer diner dishing classy comfort with Anglo-Russian panache? I love Bob Bob Ricard and echo the sentiments of all the other glowing reviews and scratch my puzzled noggin at some of the complaints I've read in some of the less than pleased reviews. There's something about this place that reminds me of going out in New York or making a pit stop at a classic roadside diner in New Jersey. Attentive service, a no-fuss but lengthy menu, great booze, reasonable prices, terrible cozy booths and the art deco/mid century modern swank ... All that in middle of London Geez ... it makes the bland, corporate coffee shop I'm sitting in right now seem even blander and drabber and almost an insult to my tastes and senses.

XSxOaKfJxIVNt_j_2oAcEg.text: Go for the atmosphere, not the food.  We didn't try the "Press For Champagne" button but watched it in progress.  We were in the green room and enjoyed the atmosphere.  Staff were all very polite and gracious.  Our waiter was struggling, couldn't remember much.  Food was ok but not memorable.

wAsPaHIb6gq9PfIrxojkIg.text: We went to BBR as recommended by a colleague, we weren't disappointed at all, the red room was beautiful, and the service was great. I would definitely recommend the Filet Mignon Rossini, the combination of foie gras, beef and the apple was just firework. i find the braised lamb shoulder ok, but my sister-in-law totally loved it. The sole was good as well, but the pork was just ok-ish compare to the rest of them.

Wjre8H7UOAg9-KQdtZo1Eg.text: I had no idea what I was getting myself into. Literally. BBR hasn't been on my radar and we stumbled in after not being able to find a table elsewhere nearby.Art deco heaven.Really nice service.Good food.Totally ridiculous bill, but I think if this was cheaper, it just wouldn't be the same atmosphere. Rhubarb G+T, excellent. Lobster mash, excellent. I was a bit perplexed by the three bird burger having wings, but ok, let's go with it. They've managed to monogram the pie, again, go with it. I didn't manage to push the famous button because well... after cocktail hour, wine and whisky to finish, I was going to be rolled out of there if I had dabbled in any more to drink. You should go once to say you've been, then go again because you felt fabulous the first time.

XFa4a1wL0rjWwj2vkp_JpA.text: My search for the best burger in London brought me to Bob Bob Ricard. Upon entering I felt like I was time-warped into a distant era---one of sheer opulence with highly trained uniformed butlers. My decadent orient express-esque booth came with not one but 2 champagne buttons. That's right, there was a button that said "press here for champagne." Of course, it's gimmicky but oh it's so cool and as our server demonstrated it actually works. Unfortunately I was battling a cold so no champagne for me. On that note the cocktail list looked amazing so next time I need to have a few drinks with my meal! My friend raved about the Pink Rhubarb Gin & Tonic.As for the burger---it was great, though not in the all-time best category, quality meat with crisp streaky bacon and some nice pickles on a fresh bun. As Bob Bob Ricard offers many Russian delicacies, I started with some zakuski---small Russian appetizer plates. The cured herring was great and the cucumber surprisingly simple (it was 1/2 a brine soaked cucumber sliced down the middle). Zaukusis are best served with vodka and there is a selection of shots with which pair your hors d'oeuvres, but alas my cold prevented me from imbibing. All in, it's an expensive eclectic experience and probably one of the few restaurants globally that serves both high-end Russian & British fare... definitely worth a visit.

Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

t7crVD5KRnSgHNWbtm1JMg.text: I have to say - I was expecting a lot of pink fluff because of the website.  The place was dark, and I mean like you're in a nightclub dark.  I can see why everyone really loves the decor and the push for champagne button.  Totally see that - and yes, the service is very attentive and for some reason houses very good looking waiters.  But of course, I am all about the food.  I had to lean on the yelp reviews in ordering a main course and went with the burger.  It was... eh.  okay, I'd give it 2 stars for the food and 4 for the service.  It was nice but I wouldn't rush back - still feeling a little unsatisfied.

9EfTafZHhvPLqMncN-YYFQ.text: I came here with a friend last night for dinner after having seen a photo of a friend with their famous "Press for Champagne" tableside button. What a brilliant idea! It's a Russian inspired restaurant, and there are a number of dishes on the menu marked as Russian specialties, but there are also a number of normal options like steak and seared sea bass. We were seated in a very spacious booth, and I thought it was pretty private, as the restaurant was dimly lit and we couldn't hear the tables next to us at all. For starters, we went for their Grilled Oysters de Gaulle and Baked Oysters Mrezhnev, which were both pretty similar, basically cheesey cooked oysters. In hindsight I probably wouldn't have ordered both and should have probably gone for some of the raw oysters instead. For my main, I got the lobster mac n cheese and my friend got the filet mignon. I really appreciated my lobster mac n cheese... it came with an empty lobster tail on top, and inside there were large chunks of lobster. It was also the perfect size. While our meal was not particularly Russian, I think it was a great spot for splurges like lobster and filet mignon, both of which were very well executed.  After our meal, we moved to the bar to have a final glass of champagne, and I thought that was a beautiful area as well. I would probably find the whole place a bit overwhelming for a date, but I would definitely come again for a nice meal and/or drink with good friends.

7GnZaDAbDadaowHCLPdPug.text: Went to Bob Bob Ricard a week ago with friends and had a blast!  It was quite the experience especially with the dancer who surprised us at around 9:30 pm.  Drinks were fantastic, but the food is ok.  My wife had the lobster mac and cheese and it was disappointing.  I had a steak and it was good, but nothing to write home about.  Very cool atmosphere.  The champagne button was also quite a hit.  I say you have to go here once but that's about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Champagne button
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Yum!

XNdrlPbsSa1EL-n_i020kg.text: This is hands down the coolest place I've eaten at in London. The interior alone is worth the visit and I guarantee your pink-blazered waiter will not disappoint on the service front!BBR is a mixture of old-school opulence and American eatery - think The Criterion fused with The Diner and you're not far off the mark. Tables are well sized and the booth seating is perfect for four people to enjoy a meal in relative privacy. On each table there is the now infamous "PRESS FOR CHAMPAGNE" button. It took us all of 5 minutes to hit this and order a bottle of the Pol Roger which was really well priced at £57 (you should read up on their wine pricing policy).I kicked off with the Egg Florentine which was a perfect foil for the champers and the egg was perfectly poached (just like mine always turn out at home of course). For main I had the potato and mushroom dumplings with a side of Brussel sprouts and chestnuts for the seasonal edge. Two bottles of the 2006 Chianti were consumed during the course of the meal and by the end of it I was mildly pissed up and quite full.Post-main, we indulged in a shot of the home-made Zubrowka. Possibly the highlight of it all for me as I bloody love Zubrowka! Tasted amazing, with a much stronger grass flavour than its commercial brother and served beautifully in a chilled cut glass. I challenge you to not love it!The perfect place for a boozy client lunch with a difference. It is erring on the pricey side but more than worth it considering the attentive service and variety the menu offers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

qMQtNEGwe2BYG4tuXSwyyA.text: I rang uo this restaurant to make a reservation for the following week, after the foreign girl answered the phone, she then said it is a busy time ( at 6pm ) and put me on hold for 8 minutes. I then had to ring back, only to speak to RICHARD who is apparently the General Manager, once i explained the situation of what had just happened, he was very abrupt, rude, and didnt seem to have any Customer Service skills what so ever. This is poor Customer Service and unacceptable for a restaurant of this standard. It only takes 2 minutes to make a reservation, future potential customers are obviously not important to the staff there, only important are customers who are walking through the door!!! I have never experienced this before when calling for a reservation. SHAME ON YOU!!!

RUFRTpJcn4uaG13PKonBoA.text: Taken for my birthday treat by 2 of my daughters. Lovely choice of aperitifs, I had a homemade pink lemonade, well 2 actually. Food choice very good, 3 cheese soufflé for me followed by beef fillet Rossini delicious, couldn't resist a desert and glad I had the warm chocolate fondant with white chocolate ice cream. Element decor and good service. Will come back again

I1xxmi-XBqNFfTD5J58NEw.text: Following the rave reviews of a recent houseguest, I bookmarked Bob Bob Ricard intending to someday come and sit at the bar and try the burger. That evening came sooner than planned when we arrived at nearby Koya to find people queuing halfway down the block.Initially we were turned down at Bob Bob Ricard when the hostess cited no tables available. Given this was our third stop of the night and that I was, by this time, rather ravenous I inquired about seating at the bar. Sure enough, we were whisked to two comfortable seats at upstairs. Unable to resist the siren-like call of the clear bloody mary I had one of those whilst my dining companion chose a glass of red wine. For you curious kittens, the clear bloody mary is made by extracting the juices of the tomato overnight. It arrived with a bottle of Tabasco and another of Worcestershire. Amazingly, the cocktail was spicy enough just as it came (and trust me, that is rarely ever the case with bloodys in Blighty.)We both ordered burgers and french fries and I was excited to be able to get mine with a Kraft slice (you can take the girl out of Las Vegas...)The burger was the best I've had in London and when I'm hit for a serious craving for one again, this is where I will go. However, the fries did not come out until quite a bit after the burgers (and after we asked after their whereabouts) which was disappointing. If you like mayo, definitely ask for a side of it here - absolutely gorgeous.Skip the cakes plate. None of them were particularly special to me and left me wishing I'd ordered something else or skipped dessert all together.Should you desire to dine on a classic American-style burger and fries whilst sipping expertly made cocktails created by pink jacketed bartenders, Bob Bob Ricard ought to be on your must do list.

_osJE5Yq-TH2D-nEqOfAgQ.text: Randomly came across BBR while searching for places to go for the ever so quintessential English Afternoon Tea. I love the whole experience of an Afternoon Tea. It's always exciting to see how it will be served. I had never heard of this place so was intrigued. I didn't expect too much from here, but was pleasantly surprised. I love a good interior and the lush art deco theme in Bob Bob Ricard had me all giddy!Initially I only wanted the Afternoon Tea, but the waitress was able to up sell me to the Pink Lemonade & Afternoon Tea. I heard elderflower as part of the concoction and I was sold. Not sure what else was in it but as long as it had elderflower. I had no regrets in ordering the extra Homemade Pink Lemonade, it was gorgeous.Good scones are what make or break the Afternoon Tea. These aren't the best I've had, but they are good enough that I'd go again. They are very generous, that can be a problem. When the scones are gone, we are still left with the very pretty looking cake selection O_o and of course you do not want to let those pretty lil cakes go to waste. They are only bite sized. But size is so deceptive!Overall I really enjoyed BBR. Tis a classy place with great service - loved the waiters jackets.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. The last tier
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea you are my weakness. Highly recommend the Homemade Pink Lemonade! As you can see they are VERY generous!!

ii9jsTW8I0R38cczxKnDQQ.text: Great resturant, staff nice, food is lovely. If your having any type of celebration  and want to splurge Bob Bob is the place. They were kind enough to even give us an anniversary treat!

ZYVlEZTjnh2R4q5IZBSQhw.text: This place makes me feel special but it comes with a price (and an expensive one)! Nonetheless, you get what you pay for and I pay more than my bank account can handle. But you know what, I think everybody should treat themselves once in a while. So if it's that time for you, give Bob Bob Ricard a go! I heard about this place from my fellow food lover and fellow yelper Enid S, and I always trust her recommendations. There's an upscale feel to it, and from the moment you walk in you're treated like royalty (pretty much). The 1920's/1930's decor is apparent throughout and the booths provide a private and intimate ambiance. They have a lovely selection of food for lunch, dinner and afternoon tea, and also provide a set menu for those indecisive individuals. The staff paid attention to my every need (possibly a bit too much attention and I think they needn't help me with my coat as it made me feel like a bit of an invalid)!BBR is one of my favorite places at the moment! It's definitely somewhere up there in my top 5. Great place, great staff, and great food! Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Butter

9gnxn_wW5v4l7T36bsCK2w.text: I was dining there in Dec 2012, definitely one of the best restaurants I've been to. We were first at the bar, which was downstairs, then we went up for a dinner. Our server was a very kind Ukrainian girl. What impressed me most was the buttons ''press for champagne'', that was very original. They asked us if we want to order champagne, and we were like, yes but first we will wait for you to go away and then we will press the button. It was fun. The meals were all delicious, my friend Nadya order some kind of fish, I don't remember the exact name, but was good. We had from those minus 18 degrees shots of vodka, very nice too. Overall I had a great time and will love to go back, when visiting London.Thank you all.

M9MpJbdI3wCrp322YpZZag.text: Champagne chicken pie, oh me oh my! Delicious food in a perfect setting. The great lighting made it feel very intimate.

IpZYIou7ErkGsBLZbiR2kw.text: This is a restaurant where I think it would be very hard not to give 5 stars.I came here for a business meeting / dinner pretty early after work, so we were lucky to get a table without a booking.For us it was cocktails, an amazing Beef wellington for 2, wine and coffee. Plus extra special waiter attention complete with the history and happenings of the place since it opened 3 years or so (it replaced Circus Circus)Very cool, chi-chi and I look forward to being lucky enough to be invited back again. Really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

ivMItUyeIwFEDXKxYxigGw.text: Think pink, think chintz, think "push for Champagne" buttons, think vodka.Walking into BBR even the air feels posh. It's like some lady is living here making sure the world behind the beautifully polished rosewood doors is a land of perfection. I've heard afternoon tea here is the done thing but I actually popped in for a cocktails. They have white Bloody Mary's which to be honest are more clear than white. They are fabulous and just as juicy as any other I've had. They have wonderfully little booths to sit in which are so cosy and make your experience feel even more special and private.This is a place to impress, a place to propose and a place to surprise someone with. Just a visit is like a present! If I could go here regularly I would, I want to come back for dinner!

PZ5u-Q72m11WSJAOFqKwgA.text: I had been waiting a very long time to come to this place and like an internet date I think i really bigged "bob" up a little too much in my mind. I'd seen the photos sort of thing but being there in reality etc... Anyway, the booking was a last minute affair so we had a late table. I loved the feel of the restaurant. It's modern and classical at the same time, its a perfect combination. The menu is imaginative and yet simple. The wine list was complicated but not overbearing. I went with three "clients" so i think perhaps the company wasn't exactly right to absorb the really, glamorous and romantic vibe of this superb restaurant - hence the four star. It's definitely the sort of place you take a lady on her birthday. I shall be back bob and review you in the right company. Wait for me x

MRVlyGrSonlhYOasAqXdoQ.text: This restaurant is genius. Absolutely fantastic food and awesome service. The 'press for champagne' button is so novel and such a brilliant touch. If you press it the waitress/waitor is there within a minute. The elegant atmosphere is the epitomy of this restaurant. Highly reccomend.

2kVUWvSvcUAt9QyUMSFSmg.text: My husband refuses to eat raw meat of any kind but I wasn't even allowed a bite of the steak tartare. Wellington is also not to be missed, and was gorgeous at Christmas.

nw_UkT-IKAzg9O222Cf_cw.text: I was so close to giving this 5 stars, but I'm holding that extra one back for somewhere that completely blows me away. Bob Bob's was almost there.I went a while back on a Gays & Gals night out - 2 gorgeous gay men and my friend and I, all lovers of food and fun times. We select very carefully for these nights out and this place was my choice. I had no idea it was at the top of the scale when it came to ostentation and styling; I'd only read that the food was great and some of the more serious restaurant critics had praised it.Art Deco glitz and glamour leaves you momentarily winded with pleasure. It's special this place, and you feel special just being there. The staff do a good job of reinforcing that feeling too with their slick but convincing geniality. If I looked at this place on paper, I might be put off. It would surely sound over-inflated, full of pomp and pretension; but actually, for all it's blingy expensive fittings and fixtures (think gold sparkly floors and ceilings, crystal glassware, marble tables and electric buttery blue leather banquettes) it's really rather un-intimidating somehow and dare I say, cosy. Perhaps that has a lot to do with the lighting - soft and sexy, which an opulent environment like this deserves. The place is humming. It feels alluring and exciting. I'd imagine Christian Grey (Forty Shades) would frequent this place if he lived in London. Say no more! So, the food. Did it let the side down? No, certainly not. In fact, it just pushed it right up there towards that 5th star I very nearly awarded and consummated my new love for the place. Clearly, a talented brigade rein in Bob Bob's kitchen and the menu has lots of rather simple dishes that have just enough pizzazz to make them their own and justify the price tag! My prawn cocktail was like no other I'd ever had - it had been given a Bob Bob boost and was stacked so prettily on the plate, I felt guilty diving in to it. My duck breast was achingly tender, sealed with rich, crispy edges that added another dimension to its texture. There were many other dishes, followed by desserts and copious amounts of wine. And yes, the bill was fairly hefty, but nothing more than you'd expect in town, and certainly not more than we thought it should be.Would I go again? You betcha. Old Bob Bobs is a winner. Through and through.

Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Prawn Cocktail - Bob Bob Stylie

AnGPqtuPy38YXvvxf3-dew.text: Average at best. Decent decor but bad vibes. Daylight robbery when it came to the drinks.

-srdwvKLAaWmQts66qxEEQ.text: great service！ salmon tarta is good, salmon is really fresh and less salty than market's smoke salmon. But I think the decoration is just like others not surprise me.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Salmon tartare!

a5OuNs1OCDFKAK9KoSGJgA.text: Home to the famous 'press for champagne' button, I love every little thing about Bob Bob Ricard. This restaurant takes you on a journey back in time to a beautiful era of art deco wonderland, yet manages to deliver a delicious, well crafted comfort food menu.   Most people are surprised to hear this delightful restaurant serves breakfast, as well as lunch and dinner. The booths are comfortable enough to spend a few hours in the morning toasting your own selection of breads and crumpets (they bring a toaster, with all the trimmings to your table) with a cup of tea, putting the world to rights or sharing a bottle of fizz on a romantic date.   The food is absolutely delicious, the chicken pot pie is probably my all time favorite dish there and I'd highly recommend it to anyone. Don't be put off by how splendid the restaurant looks, it actually more affordable than it seems!

fz75ImXQ0XhZn7HCzMB0PA.text: Went here for my cousins birthday and assumed the " press for champagne " was just a gimmick..Wow ... Just wow... Very opulent decor.. Beautiful food ... Everything on the menu we tried was amazing! The beef and the chicken Kiev are a must. Definitely heading back to try the Sunday roast!

qGOV5ppUEMUt3Mikg1YoPA.text: To mark the success of a recent campaign at work, we were treated to a celebratory meal at Bob Bob Ricard. Nestled away in Soho, the dining room is adorned with brass fitted booths, high ceilings and waiters dressed in candy pink waistcoats AND if that wasn't enough, they have a button you can press for champagne...I know right?!The food is described as a mix of British/Russian and there's everything from caviar and oysters to steaks and lobster on the menu as well as an astounding offering of vodkas.For starters, I went for the venison steak tartare which was delicious - this can be some people's idea of food hell (raw steak/egg) but for me it's perfection!Main course for me was always going to be tornado Rossini -28 day aged scotch beef with seared foie graid and confit apple served with truffle gravy. This was nice but had nothing on the tornado rossini which I've had at the Bull in Bisham. If you're ever out that way, make sure you go!Make sure you save room for dessert - my 'Eton Mess en Perle' simply stole the show. Lime meringue, strawberry sorbet, raspberry, marshmallows which desolves into a delicious mess once you're waitor has poured over the cream!

j5YYfyGdWrEjazXZhZbWaA.text: Starters included Russian (traditional) dumplings (pelmeni). The lobster, crab and shrimp ones were nice but not my favourite. The mushroom and truffled potato ones were outstanding. The sauce was beautiful that went with so good to have some bread to soak it up. Also had the venison tartare which came with a quail egg. Great presentation and a good eat.We did press the button for champagne and it was a nice touch albeit gimmick to have.For mains had the beef onglet. Nice puree and gravy. Need to order a side of chips with this though to help compliment it.The signature Chocolate Glory is a visual spectacle as its glistens in gold and as the server purs over chocolate it bubbles and cracks open. However this is a very rich and very heavy dessert that is best shared. It's not really my thing unfortunately. What was more my thing was the light and fresh strawberry soufflé. Again poured over with cream but this was a delight to finish off with.Overall the service is of the highest quality to go along with the food. All this comes at a price but I also loved the décor. Somewhat reminds me of the Grand Budapest Hotel (film). Thumbs up all around.

D33sKXJz3bJoiaC-g39R3Q.text: My partner and I loved this place. He about lost his mind seeing the "Press for Champagne" button - why not - we splurged! I had the poached sole and he had the Filet Mignon. Impeccably cooked - very flavorful without being heavy or overdone. Opted for the roasted carrots and parsnips as well as the mashed potatoes (which were the best I've ever had). He had the raspberry soufflé and I had the sour cherry soufflé for dessert - amazing! Service was excellent - very professional and courteous - they were very happy to answer all questions. The restaurant was inspired by the décor of the Orient Express. Classic art deco décor. They also have a 70's inspired dining room downstairs that is a red version of the upper dining room. It was a feast for the senses. Dinner was pricey, but worth every bit. One of the best dining experiences I've ever had. We will definitely be back again when we're in London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

0dAT7vlA1Ws_l_76SdeFag.text: We stumbled upon this place in a guide book.  A very good choice!ATMOSPHERE:Very old school chic.  The decor is reminiscent of an old train cars interior.  Light techno music played with dim lighting abound.  On the wall of the booths there is a button for champagne service & outlet for a toaster, as told by my spouse.  It was nice to see that the tables were sanitized before the tables are set.BEVERAGE:Samuel Smith Pure-Brewed Lager - Very good.FOOD:Beef Onglet & Side of Mashed Potatoes - Medium rare beef with green peppercorn sauce & caramelized onions.  The flavor of the onions were on the strong side, but the meat was done perfect.  Highly recommended.Bubble & Squeak - I learned that his was a traditional English dish.  The patties looked and tasted like corned beef patties especially with the potato filling.  Very tasty.SERVICE:Fast & friendly.

Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Beef onglet & mashed potatoes.

mM4IvYVS_y0rIhMKc42SPw.text: This review is only for the eton mess, but what a unique and great eton mess it is. My boyfriend loves eton mess, so we decided to give it a go. The dessert comes served in a ball shaped strawberry meringue with marshmallows, fresh raspberries, lime meringue pieces inside. It is topped with a warmed strawberry cream sauce, which smells unbelievably great. The server pours a bit on top after he brings the dessert to the table and then you can pour the rest throughout the course of eating it. It is small, but it's delicious. Elegant, unique, creative.The only thing I was apprehensive about before going was the attitude most restaurants at this caliber have. It's expensive, it's upscale, and a lot of times that translates into rude, impersonal, stuffy, and lame. This restaurant, though, had character. Yes it's old school, upscale, and still a bit stuffy in the sense that the waiters are overly polite, very serious, and the food is over-priced. But the place still maintains personality by the fun wall paper, decor, colors, and dishes. The restaurant is decorated in blue and teal with some quirky designs on the wall. Also, they have a "press for champagne" button at each table that you can literally press for champagne to immediately be brought to your table. We asked about it and apparently it gets used quite regularly.The tables, are marble as is much of the bathroom, which is located downstairs by the entrance. There are a whole row of individual stall bathrooms for your use, all very clean and certainly flashy. There is also another dining area downstairs, which is much less calm and more bustling than the main dining area upstairs. It's fit with a full bar as well.The dishes and cocktail options here are creative, well presented, and not outrageously expensive for the type of place this restaurant is. If I wanted a fancy, but calm dinner in a more traditional setting, I'd give this place a try because it's a bit more innovative than other restaurants in the same category. But if you don't want to eat a meal there, then just go for the eton mess. It's really worth trying.

-puyT_OvyQ-abySeRXsQkg.text: A great menu, wonderful service, brilliant atmosphere, and a button that calls for champagne to be delivered to your table.  I tested this on several occasions and found that the staff arrived in about 20 seconds, the champagne in about 2 minutes.  Also has an excellent bar with a wide range of craft cocktails.  highly recommended.

WG0P7n34MmPEhousiRoJ9A.text: Premium vodkas, reasonably priced Grand Cru champagnes, wonderful foods (must try the Chateaubriand) and the uniquely Russian dishes are a delight.

vYMnKvZQ_8fvp5AWcJCt7w.text: I read about the best Beef Wellington in London.  I planned my trip for a grand finale for a feast.  We had 7:30 reservations.   We sat down ... the place is as cool as it looks.  Shiny and bright and very hip.  And ... the waiter tells me that they just sold their last Beef Wellington.   The humanity!As a consolation, we ordered mushroom dumplings and steak tartar for apps and some fish and the Sunday Roast for entrees and the chocolate thing for dessert.  I also had some -18 C vodka and some martinis.   The whole experience is worth it, if you don't mind a slightly pricey dinner.  I was bummed out that they sold out of Beef Wellington but the rest of the food was pretty good.  Be careful about going to late and missing out like I did.

5WpByoQG_QlJe1FlkXraRg.text: After reading such fantastic reviews about this place, I expected phenomenal food and excellent service. I was terribly disappointed to find out that their food is mediocre for the price they charge. £21.50 for a thin piece of sea bass which came with a scatter of edamame and diced tomatoes... Not to mention, it was extremely dry and tasted bland. The Waldorf salad was below average as well. The desserts are slightly more impressive. Was amused by how pretty the Chocolate Glory turned out to be and the Eton Mess which everyone seems to post pictures of, was quite good as well. HOWEVER, I would not in a million years go back to this place, simply because it is way too pricy for their disappointing starters and main courses and their (excuse my language) shitty service.

5n9rVuv2rTR9z1SWb8mMwQ.text: Champagne, wafer thin truffle slices, ginormous Beef Wellington, scrumptious desserts, pink and silver. That is my Bob Bob Ricard summation. Good enough for Yelp? Probably not.When first walking in, it can be overwhelming because the BBR staff might outnumber you. After handing off my coat, we were escorted to our table. I was struck by the rectangular lines, silver and pink Christmas trees, and light pink decor. May I consider staff decor?Their staff is certainly friendly and attentive. They were a continual presence as they refilled water glasses and champagne crystal. Staff was slightly absent-like when we were nearing our table deadline (2 hour mark).I sampled nearly every item my friends ordered. There were 12 total dishes that came to our tables - starters, mains, and dessert. I delighted in my Zakuski Russian sampler in miniature, slurped my smokey Borsch, closed my slackjaw and then savored my first Beef Wellington, and forced my amazing pannacotta on my friends.I love fine dining and I love London. Thanks BBR for a memorable experience.

Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington (for two) featuring 28 Day Aged Aberdeenshire Scotch Beef served with Bearnaise sauce
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Old Bay Crispy Quail, a Two Spiced, Deboned Whole Quail served with Beetroot, Apple and Sultana Coleslaw

TtPoP3HzGWTlMUmv8UN25w.text: Wow! This place is special indeed.I went here to celebrate an anniversary as we wanted to go somewhere really special. The outside looks like a 1920's Gatsby building, and when you walk in you instantly feel glam!The seating area in the restaurant upstairs is really cool - it sort of looks like vintage train seats with tables as you are sort of cordoned off from the other tables with little curtains behind you. I suppose you could call them vintage train booths!Everyone loves the 'press for champagne' button and I did take photos of it but I did not use it after seeing the high prices of everything on the menu.The starters were nice but nothing amazing for the prices and they were really, really small. The drinks were delicious but still felt a little overpriced...I suppose you are paying for the experience and atmosphere here, too.The main that we had was the beef wellington which I can say was truly amazing...very delicious, huge and filling and cooked to perfection. The sides were delicious and the sauce complimented the wellington really well.The pudding (I had the infamous chocolate ball which is a MUST) was amazing...an entertaining sight in itself! The waitress poured hot chocolate over this golden ball of goodness and I took shed loads of photos before it melted in front of my eyes. The inside of it was a lovely surprise of several different flavours and I really enjoyed it. My favourite part of the meal for sure.There is also a downstairs here where there is a great bar and performances, so ask the staff when you can go there as it isn't always open. The decor in this place is incredible and the service is great, but if your pocket can't afford it I would give it a miss as you might feel like you were a little robbed.

yj3D0K55b5uugj1-937raA.text: BBR provides a grateful environment, however, the service and food are quite disappointing. I had dinner reservation booked to welcome my friends arriving from the States. On the day of the booking, I received a voice mail confirming the booking and subsequently returning the call to confirm. Immediately thereafter, my booking was unexpectedly cancelled. I had to make another phone call requiring additional efforts in order to secure the table. During the dinner, the Salmon tartare was stale; the Beef Wellington for three people was priced for 4 people without including the 4th portion; and the fish pie was excessively salty. Most of all, one of the friends had diarrhea following the dinner. This is our first, perhaps last time dinning there. We do not recommend this restaurant.

YpBJd08HSAVcWuD6pfsOSg.text: You must done here if you are in London. For starters anywhere that has a "press here for champagne button" gets 5 stars in my book. To go even further, Bob Bob Richard has amazing decor, with beautiful chandeliers, and pink and gold details making you feel like your in a Tiffany's catalogue. The food is amazing!  For the first course the potato vareniki is a must, with amazing hints of truffle. The crab salad was good, but cannot compare to the vareniki.  We had the baked sole and the medallions Rossini both of which we cooked and flavored perfectly and I would highly recommend. For dessert the chocolate glory is beautiful, and very nice but I preferred the refreshing Eton Mess Perle.

GSY1JeGfkfa4Ym23cw165A.text: When I am on my deathbed, please wheel it into Bob Bob Ricard and let me "Press for Champagne" one last time. Shame they've taken the Veal Holstein off the menu. Would love to paper my house with their wallpaper.

te8vOQE_7VmpJB8Pw62sHQ.text: My friend and I came here to celebrate her birthday. I loved it from the moment I walked in. Staff were very welcoming and friendly and once we were seated and ordered our drinks, our waitress asked us did we not want to press the infamous 'press for champagne' button and so said she would go away so we could press it and then return to take our order! We were obviously trying to play it cool by not getting excited about the button but loved that she humoured us! We decided to go straight to main courses and get dessert. I ordered the chicken Milanese and my friend had the lobster mac and cheese. The presentation of the mac and cheese was really impressive and you get a good sized portion and it tasted great, although my friend wasn't so sure it was worth the £25. My chicken was really nice, but I wasn't sure about the garnish/sauce on top. I ordered fries to go with it and the portion was large, enough to share. You have to order any vegetables/potatoes etc separately, dishes don't tend to come with them, which isn't uncommon at nice places. We shared a chocolate fondant for dessert, which was delicious!! The sauce that came with it was so good, it was minty and tasted really refreshing. A strange one, but so good! I loved the decor of the restaurant, the colours and different textures, it felt really luxurious and you feel like you are on a yacht or something. This place is probably more of a special occasion kind of place due to the prices, but I loved it and can't wait to go back. I would probably rate the good 4/5 but the overall experience definitely 5/5.

XPfEFqC-dATYFNPbVho4Sg.text: We were here for Beef Wellington. It was definitely exceed our expectations. The order was for two people. We also ordered dessert Eton mess, a cool dessert hasn't seen elsewhere. Recommend to make reservation ahead of time.

-TvFrKvachUhp3YQnEIXPQ.text: I was searching above and beyond in all of London for the BEST Beef Wellington.  I found it at Bob Bob Ricard.Located in Soho, once you walk through the doors at Bob Bob you feel the elegance and luxury.  We were all ushered downstairs to more private intimate dining area and I tell you I loved it.  They have a button on the table that says "Press for Champagne" guess what it works!Upon sitting down, I was introduced to Val, who is the Manager and he gave us a shot of the Russias finest vodka, Imperia.  Oh I tell you it was delicious! What a way to start my first visit here.The atmosphere reminds me of a modern/20s feel and it blended together well.  You do need to be kind of dressed in biz casual.  Appetizers--Siberian Sturgeon Caviar - Why not it had a really mild flavor to it-Siberian Pelmeni with beef tea - this are dumplings style which had lamb and beef - recommend-Salmon Tartare Imperial Main Course -1st visit - Beef Wellington - this serves 2 so if you come with a larger group, make sure to order enough.  It takes 45 minutes for this to be cooked but its a quick 45 minutes lol.Bob Bob Ricard serves the best!!!!! Beef Wellington ever.  (they used scottish beef)  The pastry was perfectly baked, the beef filet wrapped in truffle and foie, and the meat cooked perfectly.  The first bite was amazing, I was in heaven.  I have never ever tasted anything so delicious in my life.  I enjoyed each bite, the explosion of flavors and deliciousness... I cannot explain it more than saying you have to try it for yourself if you love beef wellington and if you have never had it, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?? GO ALREADY!2nd visit - Chateubriand  - Also from scottish beef.  Very good but not as good as the beef wellington off course!Sides (both visits) - -smashed peas-Truffled mashed potatoes-smashed peppered cornI was surprised they charge for bread and butter, but oh well, the food was worth it!Dessert (both visits) - -Trio of sorbets and vodka - -Signature Chocolate Glory Bob Bob Ricard will be the first restaurant I eat at during the first nigh of all my future London trips because of the Beef Wellington.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom

LmdWGJtL88y8mcVLjVoWZQ.text: I. LOVED. IT. Amazing service and food. Had the -18C shots and they were smoooooth. Service is so great! Had the Sole, baked oysters, and Eton mess. Tried my mate's lobster dumplings and pork belly and they were great too! The staff were so friendly. Even an attendant present for the bathroom. I was thoroughly pleased.   Would go back anytime.

yAfYSIHdp9mcfC5_CTYjQQ.text: I think this is a 4.5, but I will round up based on the overwhelmingly tastiness of the food.During my year in the UK, I have been on the hunt for the best Beef Wellington.  Who would have thought that I would find it in a Russian-English hybrid restaurant in London?The Beef Wellington, like all the food at Bob Bob Ricard, was expensive.  But the Beef Wellington was also unbelievably good, and worth the price tag.  The outer crust was crispy and perfectly gold brown; the steak was juicy, tender, and packed with flavor.  It was all held together with a sauce that tasted like magic.  I think the Beef Wellington from Bob Bob Ricard is a must try dish for anyone living in or visiting London.The Fish Pie was also a surprise.  It was bursting with flavors of the sea and had a beautifully crunchy crust; this is another must order.The Pork Belly was tender, the desserts were tasty.  Everything at this place is good!  Save some money, and come here for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Yum
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. The Beef Wellington

KSTtfEiVZyylTTdhCOSjig.text: So delicious!! The ambience reminds me of a train carriage in Russia! Super luxurious. Service was amazing. There's a button you can press for champagne.I got the fish pie and the BBR Signature Chocolate Glory. Very filling and tasted so satisfying. Tried my friends chicken and mushroom pie and thought that was delicious too. We had to book a couple of weeks in advance for a weekend dinner. You can't just walk in and ask for a table without a reservation. The dress code is smart attire. Great experience would visit again for that fish pie !!

nQMaLDgn4HFsNNc41yKthw.text: Bob Bob Ricard is a decadent stylish venue of perfection.Everything from the decor, staff, food presentation are absolutely top notch.Upon arrival, we were taken to our table in the Blue Room on the ground floor. It was quite dark, but lit well enough that you could see the dark blue wallpaper. Note there is another smaller room downstairs aptly named The Red Room. Apparently you can't pick the room when booking, however think Blue for nice and relaxed, Red for a little more excitement.Food was mostly good. Prices were quite high, and you're clearly paying for the ambience and decor of the place. Food was generally good, but the chips that came with our meal were too salty, and the fish pie I ordered, whilst having a lot of seafood, didn't include any mash potato. Being a mariners fish pie, you expect seafood in a creamy cheese sauce, followed by mash, then topping. All the food however was extremely rich and the starter, some Russian dumplings was divine.Dessert was a sublime signature Chocolate Glory. A golden ball with hot chocolate poured over. Whilst melted the gold to reveal a dessert of chocolate brownie, mousse and passionfruit, orange jelly. Definitely one to share and quite impressive. I wish I had taken some video.In all, this is a place where presentation and style take precedent over everything else. Great for a special occasion but not a place you'd feel entirely comfortable eating at unless money was no object.A 2 course dinner plus cocktail and shared dessert will set you back around £70 a head.

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Red room
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Chocolate glory
Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Fish pie

LC4cm_WyA9qbCghicPX0MA.text: We went there yesterday for dinner. I had Steak Tartare and champaigne. I'm used to eating raw meat and eating tartare from home - so I was excited for my order. Food arrived, i was not impressed with the taste, but i ate half of it anyway and ordered bread to eat it with. After the dinner we got home, I felt full and my stomach felt very heavy, like I had a rock in there. The raw meat in the tartare probably wasn't fresh enough, and it caused me serious FOOD POISONING.I would not recommend this dish there to anyone, YET I loved the place! It's a beautiful interior worth to visit, just don't order tartare.

d1nxwlySdBtI_D2enQCR1w.text: Beautiful restaurant. I started with the mushroom and onion dumplings, which was almost like a pasta in a light butter sauce, followed by the Chicken Kiev (breaded chicken stuffed with spinach). The chicken was really juicy and the dish was flavorful. My husband had the Imperial steak tartare (with caviar on top) and the Boeuf Bourguignon. He loved both. Finished the meal off with two chocolate truffles. You could definitely taste the bourbon. Really great service. Would highly recommend for a nice dinner out.

jcveyqpK5fiwWEte-fLzHA.text: Bob oh Bob!!!!! Bobbyyyyyyy! Bobby Boy! You make me feel all warm and fuzzy inside. Champagne on demand? Sure thing, Bob's got you. All you have to do is press a button and champagne will be Served to you. The crowd is somebody, the food pretty decent. Overall a great experience in London.

3_l4EO_zfHec94MN7ZqVSg.text: Service - very good, attentiveSiberian Pelmeni with Beef Tea  - sooooo good. This should have been my entree (based on my impending disappointment)Chateaubriand - Could have been great, BUT my steak was not served on a hot plate, thus the steak tasted like it had been cooling down for a while before someone realized to deliver it to my table, ugh, so disappointing! Thought to myself, maybe they don't serve steak on hot plates in London...randomly had an Uber driver who was a chef and he confirmed for me that plate should have been hot, even just for sanitary reasons. Well...epic fail Bob Bob Ricard.Sour Cherry Souffle - sooooo good. So at least my disappointing steak was bookended by a great appe and great dessert.Would have been 4 stars at least if it weren't for that dang lukewarm steak.

5TT3BMKxrUilM3OETNi2Xw.text: Press the Champagne button & arrives your lovely waiter with a glass of Champagne! Winning!!I loved the decor of the place, very relaxing and exciting all at the same time! We only ordered appetizers so I cannot give a review of the food, but we were all pleased with our appetizers. I ordered the Tuna Tartar, which was fresh & yummy. Great place to celebrate, birthdays, date night or just a girls night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bob Bob Ricard - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Tuna. Tartar

zDPhvUNk2sA-ozsT7YJFog.text: If you care at all about food and service...look elsewhere. Especially for special outings. You may be terribly disappointed. We clearly chose the wrong night to come to Bob Bob Ricard as there had been a power outage. However, despite these circumstances you would think a distinguished restaurant would know how to handle such situations. Wishful thinking. There was no communication to us about the fact that we couldn't order from 85% of the menu and there was no attempt to rectify the situation (besides offering 1 complimentary glass of £9 Malbec).  In the end we had terrible grumpy service, subpar (cold) food and a bill far too high for food we didn't even want to order but had to because we were starving and had no other option. There are hundreds of options in this city for a fun, romantic delicious night out and I am so bummed I didn't pick someplace else.

pTanSc-ZTXsICn4VEbabAw.text: Front desk were unexpectedly rude after a friend recommend I go there.  Last night in town and couldn't even get a glass of champagne by myself or with one friend.  Maybe they should reevaluate their front desk staff.  "Press for champagne" now in my head will always be a negative association.  More like "Press for attitude" even if you came in with no poor thoughts just a smile and excitement, you'll soon be slapped with the ego trip from the staff. #thankgod4yelp #ijustwantedchampagne

Cg0TETe9UgFvohjvT9OUVQ.text: "It's called Bob Ricard"... "Wait, Bob Bob Ricard?"..."No, wait, I don't know"Most importantly, "Press for champagne"I enjoyed myself so much that I cannot properly put my experience into words.Let me give you a few highlights...- Rhubarb cocktail is one of the best cocktails I have ever had, but I am quite fond of rhubarb. - Beef Wellington. Beef Wellington. Beef Wellington.- The interior is breathtakingly beautiful - The bathrooms are fun... - And, of course, the Press for champagne button The service is slower and easy going, but very professional and high-brow feeling. The people dining here were so beautiful it made my forehead a bit misty and I felt light headed. I don't know if I had ever experienced that before... I felt like what a young boy must feel like when he discovers that girls do not have cooties and he very much likes them. But after all, it was fashion week...

hd-3KfNMXieUr5r9f714TQ.text: AMAZING food and AMAZING service! I enjoyed every bite. The interior design was so so but hey, it is London. They give you warm bread (we had to stop ourselves from eating all of it) and butter while waiting for the goodies to start coming. Starters: Jersey Grade A Rock Oysters & Lovster, Crab, & Shrimp Pelmeni (BOMB!)Main Course: Beef Wellington & Lobster Mac & Cheese (Totally devoured both dishes)Dessert: BBR Signature Chocolate Glory - and it was heavenly glorious I must say even the presentation of it. A total must try.

It is always very complicated to choose, everything sounded amazing on the menu.I always start my meal there with a Russian starter : either pelmeni or vareniki.All dishes are just always syperb and delicious. Service is perfect, waiters are always very attentive. It's the perfect place for a first date, birthday...or just a normal dinner if you like nice and luxurious surroundings.

ymNS6YvgcsFSB6Ez4J9riA.text: Although I had a fun time with my friends I have to say that I've had equal if not much better experiences elsewhere at half the cost (or less). The vodka shots at the start certainly put us in a good mood but they also glossed over the less positive aspects of the dining experience at the time. On reflection though the experience was distinctly average. For starters, their cocktails and drinks are incredibly overpriced for what you get. I had a g&t (double) which cost £25 which is pretty high even by London standards, though it would have been okay if it had actually tasted good or been served in a larger glass than the tiny one they served it in. I chose the Truffled Potato & Mushroom Vereniki as my starts and Salmon Tartare as my main, which although really well made quite tiny. I can accept that starters are small but certainly not the main course. Perhaps I should have chosen one of the more expensive dishes, but at £16.50 I would still expect a decent portion. It was fun having the champagne button there, but the novelty really wore off after the first time, and it probably would have been cheaper to order a bottle anyways instead of pressing the button and getting a glass instead. Overall, a fun evening but at a very steep cost for what I actually got served. Glad I've tried it given the reputation but I won't be going back anytime soon.

B19jV4Ni93ntE_93uZflOg.text: everything was fine. but I was here for the beef wellington. It turns out to be really average, not worth the money.

1KLLeGqzkYG26MzrOnryIg.text: Used to be my favorite place because of the press for champagne button! However, the beef onglet which used to be amazing was overcooked and isn't what it used to be. The drinks are good and the atmosphere great but the food is not something to write home about.

35Y1LTQqy0ZshHFS_j9GUg.text: We celebrated our anniversary at Bob Bob Ricard's, while on vacation in London. What attracted us to this restaurant was the rave reviews of their Beef Wellington. We've been fans of this dish, since our days in London back in the 1990's, and we've attempted to make Beef Wellington for holiday meals with meager success. And, it was worth it! We shared an absolutely delicious Beef Wellington (for 2), and it was prepared to perfection! Just outstanding. We began with the Salmon Tartar and the Crab with Chilli and Avocado - refreshing and large enough to savor as a starter. I should add that the super-cold vodka shots were a bonus! That was followed by the Beef Wellington and a salad. And we concluded with the Flaming Creme Brulee, which was quite good. The decor takes you a bit back in time, and the Russian influence is obvious and quite nice. Don't be fooled by the "elegant" attire request - some were dressed in nice, yet definitely casual clothing (which was regrettable). Next time we're in London, we'll be back.

4e2gObwBLkDGGWe2EO4ypw.text: The highlights of this restaurant are the "press for champagne" button and the elegant atmosphere. I loved the dark wallpaper and the gold accented decor. Note that there's a dress code to dine here!First of all, the service was excellent. My friend ordered a cocktail but it wasn't to her taste so they remade it and even recommended and served her a different drink for no additional cost. The cuisine is Russian inspired and it was pretty tasty but not mind blowing. The truffle fries are worth trying though. They're crispy and loaded with truffle powder which is different from any other truffle fries I've had. We also shared the Truffled Potato & Mushroom Vareniki, Mariner's Fish Pie, and the Lobster, Crab & Shrimp Pelmeni. Flavors are quite unique and interesting but I wouldn't say amazing.For dessert, we loved the Strawberries & Cream Souffle. It's airy, sweet and well balanced. If you're looking for a better than average souffle, then I recommend trying this one.My friends and I also got some strawberry champagne to go with our meal. After all, we came for the "press for champagne" bell!Overall, I struggled to decide whether to give this a 3 or 4 star rating. The food is definitely not the spotlight here and is a bit pricey but I'd come back once in a while for the atmosphere and experience.
